weekPlan.name: Monday
weekPlan.am: Lower body + treadmill: 5 min easy walk, 15 min lower strength, 10 min brisk walk/jog.

weekPlan.name: Tuesday
weekPlan.am: Upper body + treadmill: 5 min walk, 15 min upper strength, 10 min moderate treadmill.
weekPlan.pm: Optional 10–15 min easy walk or mobility.

weekPlan.name: Wednesday

dinner.label: Fast Taco Night (lean ground beef, lettuce/tortillas, salsa)

weekPlan.am: Full body + short core (30 min total).

weekPlan.name: Sunday

lunch.label: L1 – Turkey Enchilada Skillet Bowl (or L2 if preferred)

weekPlan.am: 20–30 min easy walk + 10 min light core/mobility.

week2WeekPlan.name: Monday
week2WeekPlan.snacks: 1–2 snacks (100–200 kcal each), focus on protein + veg.
week2WeekPlan.am: Lower body + treadmill (similar structure to Week 1).

week2WeekPlan.name: Tuesday
week2WeekPlan.snacks: Greek yogurt, fruit, or hummus + veg.

week2WeekPlan.name: Wednesday
week2WeekPlan.snacks: Lighter snacks; keep closer to 150 kcal.
week2WeekPlan.am: Full body + core (shorter day if busy).

week2WeekPlan.name: Friday
week2WeekPlan.snacks: Plan ahead if you’ll drink; don’t stack extra snacks.

week2WeekPlan.name: Saturday
week2WeekPlan.snacks: Flex day but don’t blow calories; keep structure.

week2WeekPlan.name: Sunday
week2WeekPlan.snacks: Lighter snacks; prep for next week.

Produce: Lettuce / greens for bowls and side salads
Meat / Seafood: 1 lb extra lean turkey or beef (for chili)
1 lb additional turkey breast / cutlets (for Greek bowls, optional)
Pantry: Black beans (2 cans for L1 + 2 cans for chili = 4 cans)
Fire-roasted diced tomatoes (1 can for L1 + 2 extra for chili = 3 cans)

Meat / Seafood: 3–3.5 lbs beef chuck roast or flank steak (barbacoa)
Dairy: Light mozzarella or Parmesan (for stuffed peppers/primavera)
Pantry: Tomato sauce (1 can for stuffed peppers)
Chipotle peppers in adobo (1 small can)

breakfasts.title: B1 – Banana Protein Shake
ingredients: 1 scoop whey or similar protein powder
1 tbsp peanut butter or 2 tbsp PB powder
steps: Add all ingredients to blender.
Blend until smooth and thick. Adjust with water/ice as needed.

breakfasts.title: B2 – Warm Protein Oats
ingredients: 1 scoop vanilla or cinnamon protein powder
Water or almond milk to cook
steps: Cook oats with water or almond milk per package directions.
Remove from heat, stir in protein powder thoroughly.
Top with fruit and chia/flax; add sweetener if desired.

breakfasts.title: B3 – Greek Yogurt Power Bowl
ingredients: Optional: drizzle of honey or sugar-free syrup
steps: Add yogurt to a bowl.
Top with fruit, then granola and nuts/seeds.
Drizzle a small amount of honey or syrup if desired.

breakfasts.title: B4 – Savory Warm Protein Oats
ingredients: 1 scoop unflavored or mild protein powder
1 tbsp nutritional yeast (optional, adds cheesy flavor)
Water or unsweetened almond milk to cook
steps: Cook oats with water or unsweetened almond milk according to package directions.
Remove from heat and stir in protein powder thoroughly.
Stir in nutritional yeast if using, and season with salt and pepper.
Fold in spinach until just wilted, or top with any sautéed veg if desired.

lunches.title: L1 – Turkey Enchilada Skillet Bowls
ingredients: 2–3 tbsp taco seasoning (or chili powder, cumin, garlic, paprika, salt)
Optional: cilantro, green onion, jalapeño, lime
steps: Cook rice and set aside.
In a large skillet, sauté diced onion until soft.
Add ground turkey and cook until browned; drain excess fat if needed.
Stir in taco seasoning and cook 1–2 minutes.
Add black beans, tomatoes, corn, and enchilada sauce; simmer 5–10 minutes.
Stir in cooked rice and adjust seasoning to taste.
Turn off heat, sprinkle cheese over the top, and cover for 3–5 minutes to melt.
Divide evenly into 5 containers. Add cilantro and green onion if using.
Serving: reheat and eat as-is or with shredded lettuce on the side.

lunches.title: L2 – Mediterranean Lentil Bowls
lunches.kcal: ~400–430 kcal per serving • ~20–25g protein • high fiber
ingredients: 2 cups dry lentils (green or brown), rinsed
4 cups low-sodium broth + water as needed
Seasoning: oregano, cumin, salt, pepper, paprika
steps: In a pot, sauté onion and garlic in a bit of olive oil until softened.
Add lentils and broth; bring to a boil, then simmer until tender (about 20–25 minutes). Add water if needed.
Stir in diced bell peppers and seasonings; cook a few more minutes.
Turn off heat, stir in lemon juice and 1–2 tbsp olive oil.
Let cool slightly, then portion lentils into 5 containers.
Top each with tomatoes, cucumber, and a bit of feta, or add fresh at serving.
Serving: eat warm or at room temperature, with an extra squeeze of lemon if desired.

lunches.title: L3 – Korean Beef & Veggie Bowls
ingredients: Optional: sesame seeds, extra sliced green onion for topping
steps: Cook jasmine rice according to package directions and set aside.
In a large skillet, sauté diced onion until softened.
Add ground beef and cook until browned; drain excess fat if needed.
Stir in garlic and cook 1–2 minutes.
Add soy sauce, brown sugar or honey, rice vinegar, sesame oil (if using), and black pepper. Simmer a few minutes to combine.
Stir in shredded carrots and diced zucchini; cook until just tender but not mushy.
Taste and adjust seasoning with more soy sauce, vinegar, or pepper.
Portion rice into 5 containers, top each with the beef–veg mix, and finish with sliced green onion and sesame seeds if using.

lunches.title: L4 – Chickpea Shawarma Bowls
steps: Cook quinoa according to package directions and set aside.
Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).

On a sheet pan, toss chickpeas, sliced bell peppers, and red onion with 1–2 tbsp olive oil, cumin, paprika, garlic powder, cayenne (if using), salt, and pepper. Roast 20–25 minutes, shaking once, until edges are browned.
In a small bowl, whisk together tahini, lemon juice, a splash of water, salt, and pepper to make a drizzleable sauce.
Portion quinoa into 5 containers.
Top each with roasted chickpeas and vegetables, diced cucumber, cherry tomatoes, and a spoonful of tahini-lemon sauce.
Garnish with chopped parsley or cilantro if desired.

dinners.title: Teriyaki Salmon + Veggie Stir Fry
ingredients: Stir-fry vegetables (broccoli, carrots, snap peas, etc.)
Optional: small serving of rice (adjust calories as needed)
steps: Roast or pan-sear salmon for about 10–12 minutes depending on thickness, until cooked through.
Stir-fry vegetables in a pan with a little oil or spray; add teriyaki sauce in the last minute.
Serve salmon over the veggies and drizzle with any remaining sauce.

dinners.title: Turkey Meatballs + Marinara + Roasted Veg
ingredients: 5–6 turkey meatballs per person (store-bought or homemade)
steps: Bake or pan-cook turkey meatballs according to package or recipe instructions.
Roast vegetables on a sheet pan at 400°F until tender and browned.
Warm marinara sauce and pour over meatballs; serve with roasted vegetables and optional Parmesan.

dinners.title: Fast Taco Night (Lean Beef)
dinners.kcal: ~450–480 kcal per person (depends on tortillas and toppings)
ingredients: ~1/2 lb lean ground beef shared between two (or 4–5 oz each cooked)
Optional: light cheese, Greek yogurt instead of sour cream
steps: Brown lean ground beef in a skillet and season with taco seasoning.
Serve in lettuce cups or tortillas with salsa, onion, cilantro, shredded lettuce, and optional light cheese or Greek yogurt.

dinners.title: Greek Turkey Bowls
ingredients: Optional: olives and a bit of feta
steps: Cook turkey with simple seasoning (salt, pepper, garlic, oregano) if not already cooked.
Layer bowls with rice, turkey, chopped tomato, cucumber, red onion, tzatziki, and optional olives or feta.

dinners.title: Sheet Pan Shrimp Fajitas
ingredients: Shrimp (~6–8 oz per person), peeled and deveined
steps: Preheat oven to 400°F.
Toss shrimp and vegetables with a little oil or spray and fajita seasoning.
Spread on a sheet pan and roast 8–12 minutes, until shrimp are opaque and vegetables are tender.
Serve in tortillas or lettuce wraps with salsa and lime if desired.

dinners.title: Mini Personal Flatbreads
ingredients: 1 small naan or lavash per person
Turkey pepperoni or cooked turkey sausage
steps: Preheat oven to 400°F.
Top naan or lavash with marinara, mozzarella, turkey pepperoni or sausage, and any vegetables.
Bake 8–10 minutes until the base is crisp and the cheese is melted and bubbling.

dinners.title: Chili + Side Salad
ingredients: Canned tomatoes, beans, onions, chili seasoning
steps: Cook ground meat with diced onions until browned; drain if needed.
Add canned tomatoes, beans, and chili seasoning; simmer until flavors come together.
Serve a hearty bowl of chili with a simple side salad and light dressing.

dinners.title: Honey-Garlic Pork Tenderloin + Roasted Green Beans
ingredients: Optional: small serving of cooked rice per person
steps: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Line a sheet pan.
In a small bowl, whisk together honey, soy sauce, minced garlic, salt, and pepper.
Place pork tenderloin on the sheet pan and brush with the honey-garlic mixture.
Toss green beans with olive oil, salt, and pepper and spread around the pork.
Roast 20–25 minutes, or until pork reaches 145–155°F internal temperature and green beans are tender-crisp. Rest pork for 5–10 minutes before slicing.
Serve sliced pork with green beans and optional small portion of rice if needed for calories.

dinners.title: Cajun Shrimp + Veggie Skillet
ingredients: Optional: small serving of cauliflower rice or regular rice
steps: Pat shrimp dry and toss with Cajun seasoning.
Heat a skillet over medium-high heat with a bit of oil or spray.
Sauté peppers, onion, and zucchini until tender-crisp; remove to a plate.
Add shrimp to the skillet and cook 2–3 minutes per side until opaque.
Return vegetables to the pan and toss everything together. Squeeze lemon juice over the top.
Serve as-is or over cauliflower rice / a small portion of rice.

dinners.title: Italian Turkey Stuffed Peppers
ingredients: 3 large bell peppers, halved and seeds removed
Optional: light mozzarella or Parmesan for topping
steps: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a skillet, sauté onion until softened, then add garlic and cook 1–2 minutes.
Add ground turkey and cook until browned; drain if needed.
Stir in cooked rice or quinoa, marinara, Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper. Simmer a few minutes to combine flavors.
Place pepper halves in a baking dish and stuff evenly with the turkey mixture.
Top with a small amount of light cheese if using.
Cover with foil and bake 25–30 minutes, then uncover and bake another 5–10 minutes until peppers are tender.
Serve 1–2 halves per person depending on size and calories.

dinners.title: Beef Barbacoa Bowls
ingredients: 2–2.5 lbs beef chuck roast or flank steak, trimmed
Cilantro-lime rice, salsa, and red onion for serving
steps: Season beef with salt and pepper.
In a slow cooker or Dutch oven, add onion, garlic, chipotle peppers, lime juice, vinegar, cumin, oregano, and beef.
Cook on low 7–8 hours (slow cooker) or simmer covered 3–4 hours (stovetop) until beef is very tender.
Shred beef with forks and mix with cooking juices.
Serve over cilantro-lime rice with salsa and diced red onion.

dinners.title: Lemon-Dill Salmon + Sautéed Asparagus
steps: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Place salmon fillets on a lined baking sheet, season with salt, pepper, dill, and half the lemon juice.
Roast salmon for 10–12 minutes, depending on thickness.
While salmon cooks, sauté asparagus in a skillet with a bit of olive oil or spray, salt, and pepper until tender-crisp.
Serve salmon with asparagus and remaining lemon juice squeezed over the top.

dinners.title: Turkey & Vegetable Stir-Fry (Ginger-Soy)
ingredients: 1–2 tsp grated fresh ginger or 1/2 tsp ground ginger
Optional: small serving of rice per person
steps: In a skillet or wok, cook ground turkey until browned; drain if needed.
Add sliced onion, broccoli, snap peas, and carrots; stir-fry until vegetables are tender-crisp.
Stir in soy sauce, ginger, rice vinegar, and sesame oil (if using).
Cook another 2–3 minutes, tasting and adjusting seasoning as needed.
Serve as-is or over a small portion of rice.

dinners.title: Light Pasta Primavera
steps: Cook pasta according to package directions; reserve a bit of pasta water, then drain.
In a large skillet, sauté garlic in olive oil until fragrant.
Add zucchini and mushrooms; cook until tender.
Stir in cherry tomatoes and spinach; cook until spinach is wilted.
Add cooked pasta to the skillet with a splash of pasta water, tossing to coat. Season with salt and pepper.
Top with a small amount of Parmesan if using.

snacks.intro: Aim for 1–2 snacks per day in the 100–200 kcal range.
items: Protein bar (check label, many are 170–200 kcal)

snacks.intro: Aim for 1–2 snacks per day in the 100–200 kcal range.

items.name: Protein shake (½ serving)
items.notes: Keep powder on hand for emergencies.

items.name: Rice cakes (2 plain or lightly flavored)
